sentence.Network_en: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
The speaker advocated a less austere observance of the Sabbath.
sentence.Network_cn: 演讲者倡导放宽安息日的严格规定.

sentence.Network_en: It was considered a sin to work or play on the Sabbath.
sentence.Network_cn: 在安息日工作或消遣都被视为罪过.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 安息日（sabbath） (Sabbath) (出埃及记 20:8-11; 民数记 28:9-10; 申命记 5:12-15) - 最早也是最常守的是安息日（sabbath），都在每一周第七天，是按照神创.
...有触摸这一标记祈求进出平安的习惯。我们全家到现在都守安息日(Sabbath)，也就是从星期五太阳落山到星期六太阳落山这一段时 …

list.abs: And he reasoned the synagogue every sabbath and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks ., 每逢安息日 , 保罗在会堂里辩论 , 劝化犹太人和希腊人.
comes back with a sabbath sound , as of doves ., 以安舒的音调回到我心里.
Therefore , a sabbath rest still remains for the people of God ., 由此看来 , 为天主的百姓 , 还保留了一个安息的时日.
sacred service for the sabbath eve , op., 安息日前夕神圣的仪式 , 作品.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, from Latin sabbatum, via Greek from Hebrew šabbāṯ, from šāḇaṯ 'to rest'

entry.tran: 安息日(犹太教的安息日是星期六，基督教的安息日是星期日)
entry.def: The Sabbath is the day of the week when members of some religious groups do not work. The Jewish Sabbath is on Saturday and the Christian Sabbath is on Sunday.

example.ex: ...a religious man who kept the Sabbath...
Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.

means.word_mean: 1. a day of rest and worship: Sunday for most Christians; Saturday for the Jews and a few Christians; Friday for Muslims
